criteria.question: Participation of women and men in project identification

sub_criteria.question: Has the project consulted women and men on the problem or issue that the intervention must solve and on the development of the solution?
Have women’s inputs been considered in the design of the project?
Are both women and men seen as stakeholders, partners, or agents of change in the project design?

criteria.question: Collection of sex-disaggregated data and gender-related information prior to project design

sub_criteria.question: Has the project tapped sex-disaggregated data and gender- related information from secondary and primary sources at the project identification stage?
Does the project document include sex-disaggregated and gender information in the analysis of the development issue or problem?

criteria.question: Conduct of gender analysis and identification of gender issues

sub_criteria.question: Has a gender analysis been done to identify gender issues prior to project design?
Does the discussion of development issues in the project document include gender gaps that the project must address?

criteria.question: Gender equality goals, outcomes, and outputs

sub_criteria.question: Do project objectives explicitly refer to women and men as partners or beneficiaries of the project?
Does the project have gender equality outputs or outcomes?

criteria.question: Matching of strategies with gender issues

sub_criteria.question: Do the strategies match the gender issues and gender equality goals identified? That is, will the activities or interventions reduce gender gaps and inequalities?

name: Gender Analysis of the Designed Project

criteria.question: Gender analysis of the designed project

sub_criteria.question: Gender division of labor
Will the design of houses/settlements consider the needs of both women and men?
Will the project’s low-cost housing unit be so designed as to reduce women’s reproductive time or enhance their productive time?
Access to and control of resources
Will the project provide equal opportunities for women and men to own a house?
Will women be trained or employed in the construction of houses or in the operation and maintenance of facilities in the settlement?

Does the project design include measures to mitigate the adverse effects on women’s access to resources?Will women be trained or employed in the construction of houses or in the operation and maintenance of facilities in the settlement?
Constraints
Is the proposed project (housing design and common facilities) socially or culturally acceptable and accessible to women? Can women use the facility?
Will the project offer facilities and services that will support both women’s and men’s participation in different stages of the project?
Has the project designed measures to address constraints to equal participation and benefits by women and men?

Does the project include gender equality targetsand indicators for welfare, access, consciousnessraising, participation, and control? Examples ofgender differences that may be monitored: Ownership of the housing units, Satisfaction rate with the housing or settlement design and layout, Membership and leadership in homeowners’ or similar community-based organizations, Participation in training and similar project activities, by type of training, Employment generated or loss of livelihood as a result of the project
Does the proposed project monitoring framework or plan include the collection of sex-disaggregated data?
Is the budget allotted by the project sufficient for gender equality promotion or integration?

Does the project have the expertise to integrate GAD or promote gender equality and women’s empowerment? OR, will the project invest in building capacity for integrating GAD or promoting gender equality?

criteria.question: Relationship with the agency’s GAD efforts

sub_criteria.question: Will the project build on or strengthen agency/ PCW/government’s commitment to the advancement of women?
Does the project have an exit plan that will ensure the sustainability of GAD efforts and benefits?
Will the project build on the initiatives or actions of other organizations in the area?
